Description: The Meteor JavaScript Framework by Meteor helps to develop web and mobile applications. It uses a server to send data, offering full stack reactivity, enabling user interface development.

This is a Scala Backtesting and Live Trading Framework built on top of Akka/Spray. The framework can be useful for back/live testing automated trading strategies using Oanda's REST API. The API allows you to develop trading strategies and automate your trading experience. OANDA provides FX & CFD trading, exchange rates data and corporate FX payments.

Rack provides a minimal, modular, and adaptable interface for developing web applications in Ruby. By wrapping HTTP requests and responses in the simplest way possible, it unifies and distills the API for web servers, web frameworks, and software in between (the so-called middleware) into a single method call.

The Vue.JS JavaScript Framework by Vue.JS builds user interfaces on the web. According to the Vue, the core features include declarative rendering with a plain JavaScript object based reactivity system, component-oriented development style with tooling support, and flexible transition effect system. It only supports ES5-compliant browsers.

The Backbone.JS JavaScript Framework by Backbone provides structure to web apps by offering models, views, collections, and events. It connects to a developer's API in REST architecture and JSON format.
The Sunrise Shop Framework iOS Sample Code by Commercetools presents how to use the Sunrise framework to run an eCommerce project.

The Wave PHP Framework by Wave helps in building applications. It is a micro-framework built considering API, that returns XML, CSV, JSON, HTML, and native PHP. It also provides support for jQuery JavaScript framework. For more features, see the documentation, available at https://www.waveframework.com/wave/doc/index.htm

The Silex PHP Framework by SensioLabs is a micro-framework for building applications that aims to be concise, extensible, and testable. It includes JSON format and HTTP methods such as GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, PATCH, or OPTIONS. It was created by SensioLabs, the developers behind Symfony.

The Kanary Kotlin Framework by Kanary helps in building applications that feature RESTful APIs. It supports routing, controllers, HTTP helpers, asynchronous middleware, one-liners, and action lifecycle callback methods. For additional information, contact iyanuadelekan@gmail.com

The Lumen PHP Framework by Laravel is a micro-framework for building the web that can be upgraded to the full Laravel. It aims to be fast with almost zero configuration. Additional Laravel features are available at https://laravel.com/
The Limonade PHP Framework by Limonade is a micro-framework that assists in web development and prototyping, aiming to be simple, lightweight, and flexible. Inspired in Sinatra, Camping, and Orbit.
The CodeIgniter PHP Framework by CodeIgniter helps to develop web applications. It supports compatibility, no restrictive coding rules, and no configuration.
The Ember JavaScript Framework by Ember assists in developing applications with user interactions. It supports Ember CLI toolkit, routing, template engine, data layer, and Ember inspector.

SocketCluster is an open source, real time Node.js framework that is optimized to run and autoscale on Kubernetes. It can scale vertically across multiple CPU cores and horizontally across machines and instances. SocketCluster supports both direct client-server communication and group communication.

The Mocha.JS JavaScript Framework by Mocha.JS helps developers to create applications, providing asynchronous testing and flexible reports. It supports browser, test coverage reporting, JavaScript API for tests, and arbitrary transpiler support in coffee-script.

The Sails.JS JavaScript Framework by Sails.JS is a model view controller in real time that assists in application development. It is built on Node.js, Express, and Socket.io. According to Sails, it officially supports databases such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis, and local memory. Community adapters include CouchDB, neDB, TingoDB, SQLite, Oracle, MSSQL, DB2, ElasticSearch, Riak, neo4j, OrientDB, Amazon RDS, DynamoDB, Azure Tables, RethinkDB and Solr. Also provides access to various 3rd-party REST APIs like Quickbooks, Yelp, and Twitter, including a configurable generic REST API adapter.
Vapor is a web framework and server for Swift. It works on macOS and Ubuntu and provides a foundation for your next website or API.

The API Platform PHP Framework allows developers to create API-first projects. The framework can expose a REST API that works by reusing entity metadata. The resulting API uses JSON-LD, Hydra, XML, CSV, and other common data formats. API documentation is automatically generated with Swagger.

This NodeJS Framework is a module to build a bridge form BLE sensors and the Parrot CLOUD. It works with any BLE-equipped/BLE-dongle-equipped computers. It aims to mimic the Flower Power iOS/Android application on a RaspBerryPi and requires Node (with npm) and BLE libraries. Parrot Pots and Sensors for plants are a self-watering system to monitor your Parrot Pot's light, temperature, soil moisture and fertilizer levels in real time. It sends out customized recommendations and alerts to help you better care for your plants.

The Sunrise PHP Framework by commercetools is a resource to access eCommerce tools via API, presenting a demo with the categories of product overview, cart detail, checkout methods, my account, registration email, and store finder.
The Sunrise Data Java Framework by commercetools assists developers in implementing eCommerce tools via API, including CVS files to import product types, categories, and products.

The Sunrise Theme Java Framework by commercetools can implement eCommerce tools by interacting with the API, offering a demo with product overview, cart detail, checkout methods, my account, registration email, and store finder as available methods.
The Sunrise Starter Project Java Framework by commercetools can access eCommerce tools via API, providing preconditions, running instructions, and Heroku deployment as available resources.

The PhantomJS Framework allows to write scripts without the need to use a browser. Along with an API in JavaScript language, Phantom supports JSON, DOM handling, CSS selector, JSON, Canvas, and SVG formats. With Phantom, developers ca test websites, capture screens, automate pages, and monitor networking. Created by Ariya Hidayat, Jamie Mason, and Maurice Svay.

The CasperJS Framework allows navigating, scripting, and testing PhantomJS and SlimerJS, both scriptable web kits. It is written in JavaScript and it offers an API with JSON architecture. With Casper, developers can create scenarios and interfaces to navigate the web, allowing the framework to perform tasks as a computer user. Created by Nicolas Perriault and collaborators.

The SlimerJS Framework is available for download as a browser that developers can script. It enables to interact with a web page via an external JavaScript. Some of the benefits of Slimer aim to read and write files, load a page to evaluate content, simulate user actions such as click links and fill forms, monitoring the loading of a page, and take page screenshots. Created by developer Laurent Jouanneau and the developers' team La sociÃ©tÃ© Innophi.

The Serverless Framework in Node.js language, assists in the development of applications that can be auto-scalable, event-driven, and executed by pay. It utilizes Amazon Web Services Lambda with the aim to produce results without the need of a server.
The Beego HTTP Framework aims to speed up the creation of Go applications. Developers can build APIs, web apps, and backend services.
